def initialize(module_path)
  self.running = false
  self.path = module_path
end

#close_ios ⇒ Object (protected) 



96
97
98
99
 
# File 'lib/msf/core/modules/external/bridge.rb', line 96

def close_ios
  input, output, status = self.ios
  [input, output].each {|fd| fd.close rescue nil} # Yeah, yeah. I know.
end

#describe ⇒ Object (protected) 



46
47
48
49
50
 
# File 'lib/msf/core/modules/external/bridge.rb', line 46

def describe
  resp = send_receive(Msf::Modules::External::Message.new(:describe))
  close_ios
  resp['response']
end

#get_status ⇒ Object

# File 'lib/msf/core/modules/external/bridge.rb', line 23

def get_status
  if self.running
    n = receive_notification
    if n && n['params']
      n['params']
    else
      close_ios
      self.running = false
      n['response'] if n
    end
  end
end

def meta
  @meta ||= describe
end

#read_json(id, fd) ⇒ Object (protected) 



87

94
 
# File 'lib/msf/core/modules/external/bridge.rb', line 87

def read_json(id, fd)
  begin
    resp = fd.readpartial(10_000)
    JSON.parse(resp)
  rescue EOFError => e
    {}
  end
end

#receive_notification ⇒ Object (protected) 



73
74
75
76
77
78
79
80
81
 
# File 'lib/msf/core/modules/external/bridge.rb', line 73

def receive_notification
  input, output, status = self.ios
  case Rex::ThreadSafe.select([output], nil, nil, 10)
  when nil
    nil
  when [[output], [], []]
    read_json(nil, output)
  end
end

#run(datastore) ⇒ Object 



14

19

21
 
# File 'lib/msf/core/modules/external/bridge.rb', line 14

def run(datastore)
  unless self.running
    m = Msf::Modules::External::Message.new(:run)
    m.params = datastore.dup
    send(m)
    self.running = true
  end
end

#send(message) ⇒ Object (protected) 



59

71
 
# File 'lib/msf/core/modules/external/bridge.rb', line 59

def send(message)
  input, output, status = ::Open3.popen3([self.path, self.path])
  self.ios = [input, output, status]
  case Rex::ThreadSafe.select(nil, [input], nil, 0.1)
  when nil
    raise "Cannot run module #{self.path}"
  when [[], [input], []]
    m = message.to_json
    write_message(input, m)
  else
    raise "Error running module #{self.path}"
  end
end

#send_receive(message) ⇒ Object (protected)

XXX TODO non-blocking writes, check write lengths, non-blocking JSON parse loop read



54

# File 'lib/msf/core/modules/external/bridge.rb', line 54

def send_receive(message)
  send(message)
  read_json(message.id, self.ios[1])
end

#write_message(fd, json) ⇒ Object (protected)

# File 'lib/msf/core/modules/external/bridge.rb', line 83

def write_message(fd, json)
  fd.write(json)
end
